1.description: Now serves as captain of Bridge Four, struggling with his new responsibilities and the weight of command. He trains with the new swordsmaster Zahel and grapples with keeping his men safe.

2.description: A young Vorin noblewoman traveling to the Shattered Plains to find Jasnah Kholin. She draws constantly and has a mysterious spren companion called Pattern. Carries guilt about her family's past.

5.description: Arrives at the Shattered Plains and is overwhelmed by the massive warcamp. Searches for any trace of Jasnah while trying to navigate Alethi politics and culture without her mentor's guidance.

3.description: Highprince of Alethkar working to unite the other highprinces through political maneuvering and reform. Continues to experience visions and struggles with balancing honor and pragmatism in leadership.

6.description: Dalinar's eldest son and accomplished duelist preparing for the upcoming dueling season. Struggles with the political pressures from his father's reforms while maintaining his reputation and relationships.

19.description: A Parshendi warrior and explorer who seeks to understand the humans and find ways to protect her people. She has discovered new forms of power that could change the war.

50.description: The Assassin in White bound by his Truthless oath to serve whoever holds his Oathstone. Wields a Shardblade and has access to Surgebinding abilities that he believes are forbidden.

9.description: The Queen Mother of Alethkar and Dalinar's sister-in-law. A brilliant scholar and artifabrian who works closely with Dalinar to understand his visions and the ancient texts. Their relationship continues to develop.

12.description: Dalinar's younger son, awkward and scholarly unlike his warrior brother Adolin. He struggles with his place in Alethi society and shows unusual interests and abilities.

88.description: Dalinar's niece and brilliant scholar who was thought dead after the ship attack. Returns dramatically during the final battle with her Soulcasting abilities and Shardblade, having survived in Shadesmar.

15.description: The enigmatic King's Wit who serves Elhokar with cutting remarks and strange wisdom. He seems to know more about the larger cosmological forces at play than he reveals.

2.description: A cryptic spren bonded to Shallan who appears as geometric patterns. He helps her with Soulcasting and speaks in a buzzing voice, often saying 'Mmm' and asking questions about lies and truth.

1.description: An honorspren bonded to Kaladin who appears as a small woman made of blue-white light. She helps him access his Windrunner abilities and provides emotional support as he adjusts to leadership.

9.description: The massive spren of the highstorm who communicates with Dalinar through visions. He claims to be the cognitive shadow of Honor and shows Dalinar scenes from the past to prepare him for the coming Desolation.

53.description: A spren that has bonded with Renarin Kholin, though something seems different about this bond. Glys appears as a small creature that others have difficulty seeing clearly.

84.description: A cultivationspren who appears as a vine with crystal leaves. He is bonded to Lift and often complains about her irreverent attitude while helping her access Edgedancer abilities.

88.description: An inkspren bonded to Jasnah Kholin who can take the form of a Shardblade. Ivory appears as a small humanoid figure made of what looks like glossy black stone or ink.

1.description: A Horneater from the Peaks who serves as Bridge Four's cook. Loyal to Kaladin and skilled at finding ingredients and preparing meals. Claims he cannot fight due to his people's customs about weapons.

A grizzled former soldier who serves as Kaladin's sergeant in Bridge Four. Has military experience and helps train the other bridgemen. Struggles with his past and has knowledge of the Knights Radiant.
A member of Bridge Four who has become one of Kaladin's most trusted men. He harbors deep resentment against the lighteyes and particularly King Elhokar, whom he blames for his grandparents' deaths.
A Azish member of Bridge Four who was trained by the Worldsingers. He has extensive knowledge of different cultures and serves as a scribe and record-keeper for the crew.
A one-armed Herdazian member of Bridge Four known for his jokes and positive attitude despite his disability. He maintains morale and has an extensive family network that provides useful information.
A member of Bridge Four who serves as one of Kaladin's reliable soldiers. Skilled in combat and loyal to his captain and crew.
A member of Bridge Four known for his steady nature and loyalty. Works well with Skar and is trusted by Kaladin for important tasks.
A member of Bridge Four who was injured during their time as bridgemen but recovered to serve as a soldier. Loyal to Kaladin and his fellow crewmembers.
A member of Bridge Four who was severely injured and lost the use of his legs. Despite his disability, he remains part of the crew and contributes where he can.

The new swordsmaster who trains Kaladin and others in combat. He has an unusual teaching style and seems to have knowledge and abilities beyond what he reveals. Unknown to most, he is actually Vasher from Nalthis.
A parshman who worked with Bridge Four and was freed by Kaladin. He chose to stay with the bridgemen despite being able to leave, showing loyalty to his former crewmates.

9.description: The young King of Alethkar, nephew to Dalinar and son of Navani. Paranoid and insecure, he struggles with leadership and sees conspiracies everywhere. Has mysterious experiences with spren and patterns.

12.description: A cunning Highprince who opposes Dalinar's reforms and works to undermine his political position. Former friend of Dalinar and Gavilar, now turned rival who seeks power for himself.

18.description: Wife of Highprince Sadeas and a skilled political manipulator in her own right. She works behind the scenes to advance her husband's interests and maintain their power base.

22.description: A highly respected Alethi general and Highmarshal who betrayed Kaladin's squad to claim a Shardblade. Presents himself as honorable while pursuing his own agenda and the return of the Knights Radiant.

5.description: An unconventional Highprince more interested in profits than warfare. He takes Shallan under his protection and provides her with resources while she searches for Jasnah.

14.description: Sebarial's mistress and business partner who helps run his enterprises. Sharp-witted and practical, she assists Shallan and provides guidance in navigating warcamp politics.

18.description: A Highprince who initially opposes Dalinar but later becomes one of his most reliable allies. Known for his military competence and eventual willingness to work with Dalinar's coalition.
A Highprince involved in the political maneuvering between the various factions. Generally opposes Dalinar's reforms and aligns with other traditional powers.
A Highprince who participates in the political struggles between the various factions. Generally cautious and tends to follow the strongest political currents.
A Highprince involved in the ongoing political conflicts among the nobility. Generally opposes major changes to the current system and power structure.
A Highprince who participates in the political machinations of the Alethi court. Generally aligned with the more traditional and conservative elements among the nobility.
A Highprince involved in the complex political relationships among the Alethi nobility. Generally cautious about supporting major changes to the established order.
A Highprince who becomes one of Dalinar's allies in the coalition. Initially hesitant but eventually sees the wisdom in working together against the common threats they face.

29.description: Son of Highprince Ruthar and an accomplished duelist who challenges Adolin. Part of the younger generation of nobles who oppose the Kholin family's growing influence.
Another son of Highprince Ruthar and skilled duelist who works with his brother Relis to challenge Adolin. Represents the younger nobles who oppose Dalinar's influence.

44.description: A noble duelist who participates in the arena fights and becomes involved in the plots against Adolin. Part of the coalition of duelists trying to defeat the Kholin prince.
A noble duelist who joins the conspiracy against Adolin in the dueling arena. Part of the group that seeks to humiliate the Kholin family through defeating their champion.

19.description: Eshonai's sister, a Parshendi scholar who discovers new forms including stormform. Ambitious and driven to find ways to protect her people, even if it means embracing dangerous powers.
A Parshendi warrior and member of their governing council. He participates in the discussions about their people's future and the war against the humans.
A Parshendi involved in their society's decision-making processes. Works with other council members to determine their people's response to the ongoing war.
A Parshendi who participates in their society's discussions about forms and the future. Part of their community's efforts to understand and adapt to the changing war.

32.description: A mysterious member of the Ghostbloods organization who hunts dangerous creatures and people. He has an interest in Shallan and seems to know about her abilities and past.

45.description: A masked woman who works with the Ghostbloods. She appears to be from a foreign culture and assists Mraize in his operations and investigations.

35.description: A deserter and bandit who leads a group of men in the wilderness. He becomes associated with Shallan during her travels and eventually joins her group of followers.
A former bridgeman supervisor who lost an eye and deserted to become a bandit. He knows Kaladin and Bridge Four from his previous role as their cruel overseer.

relationships.Kaladin: Former supervisor of - Bridge Four captain

84.description: A young thief from Azir who has bonded with a cultivationspren named Wyndle. She has unusual abilities and a carefree attitude that frustrates her more serious spren companion.
A young thief who becomes the Emperor of Azir through unusual circumstances. He works with Lift and becomes involved in the political machinations of the Azish empire.
A mysterious figure who hunts those with Radiant abilities, believing he is preventing another Desolation. Unknown to most, he is actually the Herald Nale, driven mad by millennia of torment.

73.description: An elderly shoemaker in a small town who takes pride in his craft and helping others. He has a simple but profound understanding of service and craftsmanship.

40.description: A young Thaylen merchant who works as an apprentice trader. She travels to different locations learning about commerce and different cultures under her babsk's guidance.
An experienced Thaylen merchant who serves as Rysn's babsk (mentor). He teaches her about trade, different cultures, and the complexities of international commerce.

50.description: The elderly King of Kharbranth who appears kindly but harbors secret ambitions. He has created a vast conspiracy called the Diagram and currently holds Szeth's Oathstone.
An elderly scholar who serves as advisor to King Taravangian. She helps implement the plans of the Diagram and provides counsel on their secret operations.

59.description: A former soldier who now works to recruit others for a conspiracy against King Elhokar. He approaches Kaladin and Moash with plans to assassinate the king.

9.description: One of the Shards that came to Roshar, now dead but still speaking through visions. He was killed by Odium and his cognitive shadow lives on as the Stormfather, warning of the coming Desolation.

84.description: A Shard that came to Roshar and still lives, though she rarely interferes directly. She represents growth, change, and the cultivation of potential in all living things.

9.description: The Shard of hatred and passion who seeks to destroy all other Shards. He killed Honor and now works to escape his prison on Roshar and spread his influence to other worlds.

89.description: One of the ten Heralds who has been holding the line alone for millennia. He finally breaks and returns to Roshar, bringing with him the knowledge that the Desolation has truly begun.
One of the ten Heralds who abandoned their duty and now wanders Roshar trying to hide from their past. She destroys artwork depicting the Heralds to avoid recognition.

9.description: An ancient king and author of 'The Way of Kings' who lived during the time of the Knights Radiant. His writings about leadership and honor inspire Dalinar through the visions from Honor.

relationships.Honor: Shown in visions by - dead Shard

53.description: One of the Unmade, powerful spren corrupted by Odium. She has the ability to corrupt other spren, including those that bond with Radiants, changing their fundamental nature.

1.description: A member of Bridge Four who joined after the original crew was elevated. Works to prove himself worthy of the brotherhood and trust that defines the group.
A member of Bridge Four who is part of the newer additions to the crew. Loyal to Kaladin and works to maintain the high standards set by the original bridgemen.
A member of Bridge Four named for his distinctive facial hair. One of the newer members who works to earn his place among the established brotherhood.
A member of Bridge Four who joined the crew after their elevation to soldier status. Works to prove himself worthy of the loyalty and trust that binds the group together.
A member of Bridge Four who is part of the newer additions to the crew. Works alongside the other bridgemen to maintain their reputation and effectiveness as soldiers.
A member of Bridge Four who joined after the original crew's transformation. Dedicated to living up to the high standards and brotherhood that define the unit.
A member of Bridge Four who is among the newer recruits to the famous crew. Works to earn his place and contribute to their continued success as elite soldiers.
A member of Bridge Four who joined the crew after their elevation from bridgeman to soldier status. Loyal to Kaladin and committed to the brotherhood.
A member of Bridge Four who is part of the newer additions to the crew. Works to prove himself and maintain the high standards set by the original bridgemen.

35.description: One of the deserters who joins Shallan's group. A former soldier who ended up as a bandit but finds purpose serving under her leadership and protection.
One of the deserters in Vathah's band who becomes part of Shallan's group. A former soldier trying to find purpose and redemption through service.
A deserter who becomes part of Shallan's protective detail. Like the others, he's a former soldier seeking purpose and a chance to serve something greater than banditry.
One of the deserters who joins Shallan's group. Named for his red hair, he's a former soldier who found himself living as a bandit before finding purpose in service.
A deserter who becomes part of Shallan's protective group. A former soldier who chose banditry but finds redemption through serving someone worthy of his loyalty.

recaps.prologue: Jasnah and Shallan use Soulcasting to escape their attackers, creating a hole in their ship's hull. They find themselves in the Cognitive Realm, a strange place where the ship appears as beads and Jasnah explains they must find their way back to the Physical Realm.
recaps.1: Two months after the end of The Way of Kings, Kaladin struggles with his new role as captain while Bridge Four adjusts to their elevated status. He trains with Zahel, the new swordsmaster, and grapples with the responsibility of his position and his men's safety.
recaps.2: Shallan travels toward the Shattered Plains, drawing and studying while plagued by guilt over her family's past. She practices with Pattern, her spren, learning more about her Soulcasting abilities while trying to suppress painful memories.
recaps.3: Dalinar continues his political maneuvering, working to unite the highprinces while dealing with the aftermath of recent revelations. He meets with various nobles and struggles with the balance between honor and pragmatism in leadership.
recaps.4: Kaladin deals with the challenges of integrating former bridgemen into the military structure while maintaining their loyalty. Moash expresses concerns about their treatment, and tensions arise as Bridge Four adapts to their new circumstances.
recaps.5: Shallan arrives at the Shattered Plains and is overwhelmed by the scope of the warcamps. She observes the culture and politics while trying to locate Jasnah, unaware of what happened to her mentor during their sea voyage.
recaps.6: Adolin prepares for dueling season and deals with political pressures from his father's reforms. He struggles with expectations and his role in Dalinar's plans while maintaining his reputation as a duelist and his relationships with other nobles.
recaps.7: Kaladin trains Bridge Four in more advanced combat techniques while dealing with his own evolving abilities with Syl. The bridgemen struggle with their new roles as soldiers, and Kaladin works to build their confidence and skills.
recaps.8: Shallan seeks information about Jasnah's whereabouts while navigating the complex social dynamics of the warcamps. She begins to realize the scope of the task ahead of her and the challenges she'll face without her mentor's guidance.
recaps.9: Dalinar meets with Navani and discusses the implications of the visions and his growing understanding of the ancient conflict. They work together to decipher historical records and plan for the future while managing their growing relationship.
recaps.10: Kaladin faces challenges with the integration of Bridge Four into the army structure. Tension builds as former bridgemen struggle with military hierarchy and discipline while trying to maintain their brotherhood and identity.
recaps.11: Shallan continues her studies with Pattern while traveling, learning more about her abilities and the nature of spren. She struggles with memories of her past and the weight of secrets she carries.
recaps.12: Dalinar works to consolidate political support among the highprinces while dealing with opposition from Sadeas and others. Renarin shows unusual behaviors that concern his family.
recaps.13: Kaladin leads Bridge Four through training exercises while grappling with the political implications of his new position. The bridgemen adapt to their elevated status with varying degrees of success.
recaps.14: Shallan meets with Sebarial and Palona, finding temporary protection while she searches for Jasnah. She begins to understand the complex dynamics of warcamp politics.
recaps.15: Dalinar hosts a feast where political tensions become apparent. Wit entertains the guests while making pointed observations about the current state of affairs.
recaps.16: Kaladin continues his sword training with Zahel while managing the challenges of leadership. The swordmaster's unusual teaching methods prove both frustrating and enlightening.
recaps.17: Shallan explores the warcamps and observes their culture while continuing to practice with Pattern. Her artistic abilities help her document what she sees and experiences.
recaps.18: Political maneuvering intensifies as the highprinces position themselves for advantage. Ialai Sadeas works behind the scenes to further her husband's interests against Dalinar.
recaps.19: Eshonai explores new forms and possibilities for her people. The Parshendi debate their future as the war continues and new powers become available.
recaps.20: Kaladin deals with disciplinary issues within Bridge Four while maintaining their morale and effectiveness. The transition from bridgemen to soldiers proves challenging for everyone involved.
recaps.21: Shallan encounters challenges in her search for Jasnah while navigating the social expectations of Alethi society. Pattern continues to help her understand her growing abilities.
recaps.22: Dalinar meets with Amaram and other military leaders to discuss strategy. The visions from the Stormfather continue to provide cryptic guidance about the coming challenges.
recaps.23: The Parshendi hold councils about their people's future as new forms become available. Venli's research into stormform advances despite concerns from others.
recaps.24: Bridge Four participates in plateau runs under their new status as soldiers. Kaladin struggles with the moral implications of their changing role in the war.
recaps.25: Shallan begins to establish herself in Sebarial's household while continuing her covert mission. She learns more about warcamp commerce and politics.
recaps.26: Political tensions escalate as Dalinar's reforms face increasing opposition. Sadeas works to undermine the Blackthorn's influence with the other highprinces.
recaps.27: Kaladin faces a crisis of leadership when one of his men is injured. The weight of command and responsibility for others' lives becomes increasingly apparent.
recaps.28: Shallan's relationship with Pattern develops as she learns more about the nature of their bond. Her understanding of Soulcasting and illusions grows stronger.
recaps.29: The dueling arena becomes a political battleground as young nobles challenge each other. Adolin prepares for increasingly difficult matches while representing his father's interests.
recaps.30: Eshonai discovers more about stormform and its implications for her people. The decision to adopt new forms becomes increasingly urgent as the war continues.
recaps.31: Bridge Four trains for their new roles while maintaining their unique identity and brotherhood. Kaladin works to balance military discipline with the bonds that saved them all.
recaps.32: Shallan encounters members of the Ghostbloods organization who show interest in her abilities and past. Mraize introduces himself as someone with knowledge of her secrets.
recaps.33: The highprinces gather for political discussions that reveal the deep divisions in Alethi leadership. Dalinar's position becomes increasingly precarious.
recaps.34: Parshendi society grapples with the implications of adopting stormform. The debate over their people's future intensifies as traditional ways clash with survival needs.
recaps.35: Shallan encounters deserters and bandits during her travels, including Vathah and his crew. These former soldiers present both danger and opportunity.
recaps.36: Kaladin leads Bridge Four on dangerous missions while trying to minimize casualties. The moral complexities of their new role create internal conflicts.
recaps.37: Dalinar seeks support from various highprinces while dealing with increasing political isolation. Amaram's involvement in his plans becomes more significant.
recaps.38: Shallan begins to integrate with Sebarial's operations while maintaining her search for Jasnah. Her artistic skills prove valuable in unexpected ways.
recaps.39: The Parshendi face internal divisions over the adoption of stormform. Eshonai and Venli represent different approaches to their people's survival.
recaps.40: An interlude featuring Rysn and her merchant training provides insight into the broader world beyond the Shattered Plains. Trade and cultural exchange continue despite the war.
recaps.41: Dalinar experiences another vision from the Stormfather that provides more information about the ancient past and the coming Desolation. Wit offers cryptic counsel.
recaps.42: Shallan's interactions with her new allies and guards develop as she works to understand the political landscape. Her mission becomes more complex and dangerous.
recaps.43: Bridge Four faces new challenges as they adapt to their role as Dalinar's personal guard. Kaladin struggles with the politics and expectations of his position.
recaps.44: The dueling arena becomes the scene of elaborate plots against Adolin as multiple opponents coordinate to defeat him. Political and personal stakes intertwine.
recaps.45: Shallan encounters more members of the Ghostbloods and begins to understand their interest in her. The mysterious organization's goals remain unclear but significant.
recaps.46: Dalinar and his family deal with the increasing political pressure from other highprinces. The unity he seeks seems increasingly elusive as opposition grows.
recaps.47: Kaladin trains with Zahel while dealing with the complexities of his position between military duty and political intrigue. The swordmaster's lessons extend beyond mere combat.
recaps.48: Shallan's group encounters dangers in the wilderness as they navigate toward their destination. Leadership challenges emerge as she works to protect her companions.
recaps.49: The highprinces' council meetings reveal deep fractures in Alethi leadership. Dalinar's reforms face organized resistance from multiple quarters.
recaps.50: Szeth receives new orders from his current master, Taravangian. The Assassin in White continues his deadly mission while questioning the morality of his actions.
recaps.51: Bridge Four faces new military challenges while maintaining their brotherhood. Kaladin works to balance their effectiveness as soldiers with their bonds as family.
recaps.52: Shallan settles into her temporary arrangements while continuing her covert mission. The search for Jasnah becomes more desperate as time passes.
recaps.53: Dalinar experiences troubling visions and revelations about the past while dealing with present political crises. Renarin's strange behavior becomes more pronounced.
recaps.54: Parshendi society continues to fracture over the adoption of stormform. The debate over survival versus tradition reaches a critical point.
recaps.55: Kaladin leads his men through dangerous situations while grappling with the moral implications of their orders. The weight of command continues to challenge him.
recaps.56: Shallan's relationship with her guards and companions develops as they face shared dangers. Trust and loyalty become crucial for survival.
recaps.57: Political maneuvering reaches new heights as various factions position themselves for advantage. Wit provides cryptic observations about the state of affairs.
recaps.58: The Parshendi make crucial decisions about their future that will affect the course of the war. New forms bring new powers but also new dangers.
recaps.59: Kaladin is approached by conspirators who seek to recruit him for plots against King Elhokar. The moral complexity of the situation weighs heavily on him.
recaps.60: Shallan's encounters with the Ghostbloods intensify as their interest in her becomes more apparent. The mysterious organization's goals remain hidden but significant.
recaps.61: Bridge Four continues to evolve in their new role while maintaining their essential identity. Kaladin struggles with leadership decisions that affect his men's lives.
recaps.62: Adolin faces his greatest dueling challenge yet as multiple opponents coordinate against him. The political implications of victory or defeat affect his entire family.
recaps.63: Dalinar's political position becomes increasingly precarious as opposition to his reforms solidifies. The unity he seeks seems more distant than ever.
recaps.64: Eshonai and the Parshendi make fateful decisions about adopting stormform despite the risks involved. The transformation of their people begins.
recaps.65: Kaladin deals with the aftermath of difficult decisions while trying to maintain Bridge Four's morale and effectiveness. Leadership proves increasingly challenging.
recaps.66: Shallan's temporary arrangements begin to stabilize while she continues her search for Jasnah. New relationships and alliances form in unexpected ways.
recaps.67: The consequences of recent events begin to unfold as various plots and plans come to fruition. Political tensions reach dangerous levels.
recaps.68: Dalinar faces a crisis that threatens everything he has worked to build. The visions from the past take on new urgency as present dangers multiply.
recaps.69: Kaladin confronts the full implications of the conspiracy against Elhokar while wrestling with his own feelings about the king. Moral complexity deepens.
recaps.70: Bridge Four faces their most challenging mission yet while Kaladin grapples with impossible choices. The bonds of brotherhood are tested by circumstance.
recaps.71: Shallan's mission takes a dramatic turn as new information comes to light. Her relationship with Adolin begins to develop in unexpected ways.
recaps.72: Political alliances shift as the highprinces respond to recent events. Dalinar's position becomes even more precarious as opposition organizes against him.
recaps.73: An interlude featuring Ym the cobbler provides a different perspective on service and craftsmanship. Simple wisdom contrasts with the complexity of the main plot.
recaps.74: Shallan's encounter with the Ghostbloods reaches a critical point as their true nature becomes clearer. Dangerous revelations emerge about their objectives.
recaps.75: The dueling arena becomes the scene of major political confrontation as various factions clash. Personal and political stakes reach their highest point yet.
recaps.76: Kaladin faces the consequences of his choices regarding the conspiracy while trying to protect those he cares about. Leadership demands terrible decisions.
recaps.77: The transformation of the Parshendi accelerates as stormform spreads through their ranks. Eshonai experiences the power and danger of the new form.
recaps.78: Szeth continues his mission while wrestling with the moral implications of his actions. The conflict between duty and conscience intensifies.
recaps.79: Shallan's relationships and alliances reach a turning point as various plots converge. Her true mission becomes increasingly dangerous and complex.
recaps.80: Dalinar faces his greatest crisis as everything he has built threatens to collapse. The visions from Honor take on desperate urgency.
recaps.81: Bridge Four prepares for their most dangerous mission while Kaladin makes crucial decisions about loyalty and duty. The bonds of brotherhood face ultimate testing.
recaps.82: Shallan's encounter with danger forces her to use her abilities in new ways. The truth about her past begins to surface with potentially devastating consequences.
recaps.83: Political tensions explode as various factions finally move openly against each other. The carefully maintained balance of power begins to shatter.
recaps.84: An interlude featuring Lift provides insight into another emerging Radiant while introducing the Herald known as Darkness. New powers and ancient threats converge.
recaps.85: Szeth's mission reaches a critical juncture as he faces the full implications of his actions. The Assassin in White confronts questions about duty and morality.
recaps.86: The Parshendi in stormform prepare for their final assault while Eshonai struggles with the changes to herself and her people. Transformation comes with unexpected costs.
recaps.87: All plotlines converge as the various crises reach their climax. Dalinar faces the ultimate test of his beliefs and leadership while ancient powers awaken.
recaps.88: The Battle of Narak begins as all factions clash in the culminating conflict. Long-hidden truths are revealed and presumed-dead allies return at the crucial moment.
recaps.89: The climactic battle concludes with the revelation of the Everstorm and the return of the Desolation. Taln arrives broken, and the true scope of the coming crisis becomes clear.
